| Module | Objective | Delivery | Overview | Outcomes | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | Getting the culture right | Create a complete Communication Plan on this strategy | Consult | To successfully build a culture of acceptance, it's vital to involve all stakeholders in your journey and create a comprehensive communication strategy. This will ensure that your stakeholders are well-informed and supportive of your initiative. | 1. A tailored communication plan for stakeholder engagement.
2. Internal approval from the board, colleagues, and hiring managers.
3. External approval from clients, commissioners, and beneficiaries.
4. A cohesive approach to communicating your commitment to hiring people with convictions. | | Getting the culture right | Appoint an Ex-offender Inclusion Champion | Consult | Designate an Ex-offender Inclusion Champion to represent the voice of people with convictions and ensure they remain a priority. Incorporating this role into existing EDI roles ensures ongoing representation and support. | 1. A designated Ex-offender Inclusion Champion.
2. A clear understanding of the role's responsibilities and scope.
3. Integration of the Ex-offender Inclusion Champion into existing EDI roles and meetings.
4. A single point of contact for colleagues regarding the strategy and support for people with convictions. | | Getting the culture right | Create a bank of case studies of existing colleagues with convictions | Consult | Develop a collection of real-life case studies showcasing colleagues with convictions, while managing potential risks and GDPR compliance challenges. These case studies will inspire and change perceptions across the organisation. | 1. A carefully curated collection of case studies highlighting colleagues with convictions.
2. An understanding of GDPR compliance and risk management related to the case studies.
3. An effective tool to change perceptions and build a more inclusive culture. | | Getting the culture right | Launch an annual colleague ex-offender perception survey | Consult | Assess your organisation's culture by launching an annual anonymous survey to identify gaps in training or stakeholder consultation. This will help you monitor progress and improvements over time in welcoming and supporting people with convictions. | 1. An annual anonymous survey to gauge colleague perceptions.
2. Identification of training and consultation gaps.
3. Insights into the current organisational culture and its impact on people with convictions.
4. A tool to track improvements and cultural shifts over time. | Please note that the updated overviews are designed to focus on the client's perspective and what they will gain from each objective. The suggested activities and outcomes have been incorporated to ensure a comprehensive approach for each objective within the 'Getting the Culture right' module.
